docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 17 -- The Foreign Ministry announced today the receipt of a note delivered to the Argentine Embassy in Berlin yesterday in which the German Government acknowledged responsibility for the torpedoing of the Argentine...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 17 -- The Foreign Ministry announced today the receipt of a note delivered to the Argentine Embassy in Berlin yesterday in which the German Government acknowledged responsibility for the torpedoing of the Argentine tanker Victoria off the United States coast just two months ago.

headline.main: NAZI NOTE ADMITS ARGENTINE SINKING; Apologizes for Torpedoing the Tanker Victoria, Laying Attack to 'Error' BERLIN OFFERS INDEMNITY Buenos Aires Withholds Text of Reply, but Appears to View Case as Closed

docs.snippet: According to a London dispatch in this newspaper yesterday, the British Foreign Office is pondering seriously the bringing up in the peace conference of a proposal to end the distinction between Ministers and Ambassadors and to give to the chief...
docs.lead_paragraph: According to a London dispatch in this newspaper yesterday, the British Foreign Office is pondering seriously the bringing up in the peace conference of a proposal to end the distinction between Ministers and Ambassadors and to give to the chief diplomatic representatives of all nations the latter title.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 26 -- Latin America, whose financiers and economists will meet in Washington next Tuesday to implement the Rio de Janeiro resolutions of January 28, has been forced by the war to trade with itself to an absolutely unprecedented...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 26 -- Latin America, whose financiers and economists will meet in Washington next Tuesday to implement the Rio de Janeiro resolutions of January 28, has been forced by the war to trade with itself to an absolutely unprecedented degree.
docs.abstract: Article by R C Beyer in U S Commerce Dept pub cited

headline.main: HOME TRADE SOARS IN LATIN AMERICA; Trend to Self-Sufficiency, Due to War, Is Shown by Report to U.S. Commerce Bureau HOME TRADE SOARS IN LATIN AMERICA
